text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Game Pocket Computer is a handheld game console released by Epoch in Japan in 1984, predating the Game Boy by 5 years. It is equipped with a 6 Mhz NEC processor, 2 kB of RAM and a mono sound output. It displays a resolution of 75x64 pixels in monochrome. It also includes two games, a puzzle and a painting program. But the system will be a real failure and therefore only 5 games will be marketed.
